issue.title: [DOC] Feedback thread on tutorial notebooks

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This issue is for collecting feedback on the tutorial notebooks.

Any feedback is highly appreciated, positive or critical; can be high-level (e.g., too long where, helpful why, confusing how), or concrete, e.g., content that should be added, changed, removed, shortened, structured differently, etc.

body: First half is a good first issue, since it's "moving stuff around", i.e., adding, moving or removing sections, adding links.
(what do the other core devs think?)
@fkiraly can I work on the first half of this issue ??
Hi Franz! I would like to work on this issue too. :)

Great, @ner-aim, @Ris-Bali, your'e welcome!
Would you mind briefly stating precisely which bits you would like to work on, and possibly align/agree, to avoid duplication?
(feel free to collaborate and split the work if you want to)

Hello i want to help in  tutorial for metrics.
i am new to open source so if you can guide me how to start?

> Great, @ner-aim, @Ris-Bali, your'e welcome! Would you mind briefly stating precisely which bits you would like to work on, and possibly align/agree, to avoid duplication? (feel free to collaborate and split the work if you want to)

Sure! I am sorry I have an exam today and I couldn't reply earlier. I will let you guys know in the evening and how I plan about it. I would like to discuss with you too, @Ris-Bali
I would like to take the last two u can take the first two, if its okay with u @ner-aim

> I would like to take the last two u can take the first two, if its okay with u @ner-aim

Hey Ris! Yeah sure, I will work on it starting today. Sorry for the delay, but now I am done with the exam, I will go through the second two tasks. Let's help out each other in any way possible.
@fkiraly  is this issue solved? if not i would like to work on it.
